hanzi-su-wiki:
偉

Значения

Выдающийся, огромный, серьёзный

Мнемоника

Человек 亻, способный без помощи растянуть сырую кожу 韋, силач.

Варианты

伟

Pictophonetic: 韋 indicates the sound; 亻 (person) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
偉大 [ wěi dà ]: huge; great; grand; worthy of the greatest admiration; important (contribution etc)
偉業 [ wěi yè ]: exploit; great undertaking
偉人 [ wěi rén ]: great person

    • 韋 [ wéi ] tanned leather; surname
heisig_chinese_memo: Mr. T is certainly a great person, so much so that parents are buying lockets with his picture in it and having their children wear them like amulets.
heisig_constituent: admirable, person, locket, stick, key, mouth, monocle, sunglasses with one lens missing
Keyword_KANJIDIC: admirable, greatness, remarkable, conceited, famous, excellent
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: восхищения, величие, замечательные, тщеславный, известные, отлично
koohiiStory1: LOCKETs often carry inside them a picture of a PERSON we find ADMIRABLE.
koohiiStory2: For locket: The locket (key dangling from something, the vertical stroke) opens like a mouth, but you need a jeweler´s monocle to make out the pictures within. ----- Dracula survives a staking attempt when the locket with Mina´s admirable picture deflects the blow. "It was an admirable attempt," he admits as he sucks his attacker´s blood.
jp_example_words:
偉大(いだい): greatness
偉い(えらい): great, celebrated, eminent, terrible, awful, famous, remarkable, excellent
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The leader of Korea is destined for greatness.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: I mean, they're the leader of Korea already, right? So they have to have a decent chunk of greatness in them already to get that far.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: The greatness radiates off of the leader of Korea, so much so that you can hardly look. Just when you're about to close your eyes to shield them from the greatness, a great eagle (い) soars over them, letting out a cry.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Picture the greatness of the scene before you: the leader of Korea, a great eagle overhead, it's so great!!
Ru_Meaning: admirable, greatness, remarkable, conceited, famous, excellent
Ru_trainchinese: wěi: (графема) большой, высокий; великий, грандиозный
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the man (亻) with the tanned leather (韋) is illustrious
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Mr. T is the only person great enough to have walked right through the briar patch with no tanned hide for protect.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " people " to " Wei " sound. The original meaning is strange and peculiar. "Said Wen": "Wei, Qi Ye. From people, Wei Sheng." Such as "Guan Zi. Ren Fa": "No great clothes, no strange behavior." "Lun Heng. Opposite: "So the "Lun Heng" people, so the words of lightness and weight, the peace of truth and falsehood, are not the rhetoric of Gao Tiaowen, it is a view of strangeness."

" Wei " also means excellence. Such as "Zhuangzi. Great Master": "The creator of the great husband will be detained for this!" "Selected Works. Chen Kongzhang's "For Yuan Shao's Yuzhou": "So Jiujiang's prefect of the border, talented and handsome, well-known in the world, straightforward, not flattering."

" Wei " means tall. "Jade articles. "Human Ministry": "Wei, Da Ye." Such as "Book of Later Han Dynasty. "The Biography of Geng Chang": "Bingzi Bochu, with a great body, and a belt around eight." Three Kingdoms Wei Cao Pi "Liu Fu": "The great woods of the Yizhong region, magnificent and wonderful." It also means grand, such as "Preface to the Pavilion of the King of Teng" by Wang Bo of the Tang Dynasty: "Farewell to give a message, fortunately to honor Yu Weijian.
humanum_short_description_en: From " people " to " Wei " sound. The original meaning is strange and peculiar.
humanum_full_description:
從「人」，「韋」聲。本義是奇異、奇特。《說文》：「偉，奇也。从人，韋聲。」如《管子．任法》：「無偉服，無奇行。」《論衡．對作》：「故《論衡》者，所以銓輕重之言，立真偽之平，非苟調文飾辭，為奇偉之觀也。」

　　「偉」又表示卓越。如《莊子．大宗師》：「偉哉夫造物者，將以予為此拘拘也！」《文選．陳孔璋〈為袁紹檄豫州〉》：「故九江太守邊讓，英才俊偉，天下知名，直言正色，論不阿諂。」

　　「偉」表示高大。《玉篇．人部》：「偉，大也。」如《後漢書．耿弇列傳》：「秉字伯初，有偉體，腰帶八圍。」三國魏曹丕〈柳賦〉：「伊中域之偉木兮，瑰姿妙其可珍。」亦表示盛大，如唐代王勃〈滕王閣序〉：「臨別贈言，幸承恩於偉餞。」
humanum_short_description: 從「人」，「韋」聲。本義是奇異、奇特。

偉大(いだい): greatness
偉い(えらい): great, celebrated, eminent, terrible, awful, famous, remarkable, excellent

從「 人 」，「 韋 」聲。本義是奇異、奇特。《說文》：「偉，奇也。从人，韋聲。」如《管子．任法》：「無偉服，無奇行。」《論衡．對作》：「故《論衡》者，所以銓輕重之言，立真偽之平，非苟調文飾辭，為奇偉之觀也。」 「 偉 」又表示卓越。如《莊子．大宗師》：「偉哉夫造物者，將以予為此拘拘也！」《文選．陳孔璋〈為袁紹檄豫州〉》：「故九江太守邊讓，英才俊偉，天下知名，直言正色，論不阿諂。」 「 偉 」表示高大。《玉篇．人部》：「偉，大也。」如《後漢書．耿弇列傳》：「秉字伯初，有偉體，腰帶八圍。」三國魏曹丕〈柳賦〉：「伊中域之偉木兮，瑰姿妙其可珍。」亦表示盛大，如唐代王勃〈滕王閣序〉：「臨別贈言，幸承恩於偉餞。」
From " people" to " Wei" sound. The original meaning is strange and peculiar. "Said Wen": "Wei, Qi Ye. From people, Wei Sheng." Such as "Guan Zi. Ren Fa": "No great clothes, no strange behavior." "Lun Heng. Opposite: "So the "Lun Heng" people, so the words of lightness and weight, the peace of truth and falsehood, are not the rhetoric of Gao Tiaowen, it is a view of strangeness." " Wei" also means excellence. Such as "Zhuangzi. Great Master": "The creator of the great husband will be detained for this!" "Selected Works. Chen Kongzhang's "For Yuan Shao's Yuzhou": "So Jiujiang's prefect of the border, talented and handsome, well-known in the world, straightforward, not flattering." " Wei" means tall. "Jade articles. "Human Ministry": "Wei, Da Ye." Such as "Book of Later Han Dynasty. "The Biography of Geng Chang": "Bingzi Bochu, with a great body, and a belt around eight." Three Kingdoms Wei Cao Pi "Liu Fu": "The great woods of the Yizhong region, magnificent and wonderful." It also means grand, such as "Preface to the Pavilion of the King of Teng" by Wang Bo of the Tang Dynasty: "Farewell to give a message, fortunately to honor Yu Weijian.

偉字的基本解释

偉
wěi
见“伟”。

偉字的汉语字典释义

[①]［wěi］
［《廣韻》于鬼切，上尾，云。］
“伟1”的繁体字。
(1)奇异。
(2)伟大；卓越。
(3)壮大；盛大。
(4)认为奇异；认为出色；崇敬。
(5)姓。汉代有偉璋。见四部备要本《後汉书·蔡邕传》。

偉字的康熙字典解释

【子集中】【人字部】　偉； 康熙笔画：11； 页码：页110第05
【唐韻】于鬼切【集韻】【韻會】羽鬼切，?音韙。【說文】奇也。【徐曰】人才傀偉。【增韻】大也。【史記·?平世家】張負旣見之喪所。獨視偉平。【韓詩外傳】仁者好偉，和者好粉。　又姓。漢光祿勲偉璋。　又【正韻】于貴切，音胃。【陸機·文賦】彼榛楛之勿翦，亦蒙榮於集翠。綴下里於白雪，吾亦濟夫所偉。

偉字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
偉字的起名意思

暂无。

Great
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［wěi］
["Guangyun" Yu Guiqie, Shangwei, Yun. ]
Traditional characters for "伟1".
(1) Strange.
(2) Great; excellent.
(3) Strengthen; grand.
(4) Think strange; think excellent; respect.
(5) Last name. There was Weizhang in the Han Dynasty. See the four preparatory editions "The Book of the Later Han·Biography of Cai Yong".
Great
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Subset] [Human Character Department] 　wei; Kangxi Strokes: 11; Page Number: Page 110 05
[Tang Yun] Yu Guiqie [Jiyun] [Yunhui] Yuguiqie,? Yin Yun. [Said Wen] Qi Ye. [Xu Yue] Talent puppet Wei. [Zeng Yun] Da Ye. 【Historical Records·? Ping Shijia】The funeral home where Zhang Shizhang saw. See Weiping alone. [Han Shiwai Biography] The benevolent is great, and the harmony is a fan.　Another last name. Han Guanglu Miao Weizhang.　[Zheng Yun] Yu Guiqie, sound stomach. [Lu Ji·Wen Fu] He Zhenzhu's Wu Jian is also glorious in Ji Cui. Embellished in Baixue, I also help my husband.

Name meaning

wěi
вм. 伟
Radicals: ｲ, 韋  (leader, korea)
Meaning Mnemonic
The leader of Korea is destined for greatness.
I mean, they're the leader of Korea already, right? So they have to have a decent chunk of greatness in them already to get that far.
Reading Mnemonic
The greatness radiates off of the leader of Korea, so much so that you can hardly look. Just when you're about to close your eyes to shield them from the greatness, a great eagle (い) soars over them, letting out a cry.
Picture the greatness of the scene before you: the leader of Korea, a great eagle overhead, it's so great!!
